div.l: A ha quod he for cristes own passioun
This myllere hath a sharp conclusioun
Vpon his argument of herbegage
Wele soth sayde Salamon in his langage
Ne bringe nat euery man in thy house
For herbouryng by nyght is parlous
Wele ought a man auysed for to be
Whom that he bring into his pryuytye
I pray to god to yeue me sorow and care
If euir sithen I hight hodge of ware
Herd I myller bet y set a werke
He hadde a iape of malice in the derke
But goddes forbede that we styntyn here
And therfore if ye wouchsauf to here
A tale of me that am a poure man
I wol you telle as wele as I can
A lytel iape that felle in oure cyte
Oure hoost aunswerd and sayde I graunt it the
Now telle on Roger loke that it be gode
For many a pasty hast thou let blode
And many a iacke of douyr hast thou solde
That hadde been twyes hote and twyes colde
Of many a pylgrame hast thou cristes curse
For of thy persely yet fare they the wers
That they haue eten with the stubbed goos
For in thy shoppe is many a flye loos
Nowe telle on gentyl Roger be thy name
But I pray the be nat wrothe for game
A man may say fulle sothe in game and play
Thou sayst soth quod Roger by my fay
But soth pley quade pley as the flemyng sayth
And therfore harry bally by thy fayth
Be thou nat wroth or we departen here
